summary: This document contains technical details regarding Call Detail Records (CDR) from T-Mobile, outlining the structure and content of the records, including call types, durations, and other metadata. It emphasizes the limitations of the data, such as the lack of content for text messages and the inability to convert time to local time zones.
keyFacts: The document provides a detailed explanation of Call Detail Records (CDR) from T-Mobile, including various columns and their meanings.
T-Mobile does not retain the content of text messages, and calls made while roaming do not appear in the report.
The records are presented in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), which may differ from local time zones.
The document outlines various call types, including forwarded calls, outgoing and incoming voice calls, and SMS.
There are specific identifiers for LTE calls, including Site ID and Sector ID, which are included in the records.
